text: Any one feel like translating what the speech bubbles say?  That would be rad.

text: A comment left by retardo was marked lame too many times and excluded. name: stella
text:
1 - " i have company"
2 - correct translation in the black field
3 - dogs don't like fruits (correct german would be: Hunde mögen keine Früchte)
4 - ...
5 - Dogs like to fuck and sleep

name: agika
text:
" Correct German would be..."

Daaaamn, Chris; Stella shut you down cold. Also, I have learned a useful new German word today: Bumsen (Incidentally, how does one conjugate that? Is it a regular verb?)

name: stella
text: ich bumse, du bumst, er/sie/es bumsen, wir bumsen, ihr bumst. Also the word "could" mean to bump, like I bumped in your car (?).. but nobody really says that.

name: foea
text: It'd be "bumped into"... "I bumped in your car" means the same thing pretty much world-round, and calls for a high-five and a paper towel, instead of an exchange of insurance info.

name: i_love_kate
text: Er/sie/es bumst, surely.

name: catachresis
text: My basic grasp of German got me everything but "Bumsen". Happily, it was close to my original thoughts.

name: lugosh
text: Perhaps it is meant to be: "Dogs like no fruit", which is slightly different than "Dogs do not like fruit". In which case... maybe the German is correct?

name: saulbellow
text:
Um, the only way Germans know how to say "Dogs don't like fruit" is to say "Dogs like no fruit."

So your suggestion is giving me brain cancer.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Dogg, you should have essen more frucht.

name: laerm
text: actually... we could have "frucht gefällt hunden nicht", which literally comes out to "fruit does not please dogs" or more smoothly "dogs do not like fruit". and then you could add "hunde mögen keine fruchte": "dogs like no fruit". "hunde mögen fruchte nicht" is "dogs do not like fruit". so, er, three cheers for pedantry 9 months later.

name: saulbellow
text:
I guess what I meant was that "like no fruit" would be the word order used in German to mean "don't like fruit."

Assetbar doesn't like umlauts.

name: laerm
text:
ah, right, gotcha.

it'll umlaut alright, just switch yer encoding. assetbar doesn't do unicode (oddly enough).

name: hamhock
text: Dang, that monument got some creepy lips

name: ghostd
text: Everything about Klaus Nomi is incredibly creepy.

name: mira
text: Thank you for that link. You just added layers to this comic for me. Layers .

name: lastlarf
text: Gotta love Nomi though. Just amazing. In an intesnsely creepy way, granted.

name: darleen
text: Apparently he died on the day I was born. :|

name: i_love_kate
text: Maybe you inherited his powers.

name: tekende
text: Y O U R  F A U L T

name: senseihollywood
text: yes, excellent catch

name: foea
text: Including his Venture Brothers appearance.

name: poodlelucy
text: damnit, how come you gotta make me look for him on youtube, onstad, HOW COME?

name: poodlelucy
text: if my comment had alt text: the high school music teacher did indeed look him up, and was very frightened.

name: terribleman
text: Link is dead. Try this .

name: wonelove
text: Teodor has those lips...

name: donsoze
text: I really don't blame Teodor for disgracing his monument, it was pretty darn creepy looking.

name: catachresis
text: Mad, mad love for mentioning the gorgeous nectar of Lowenbrau. "The best lager that exists in a can".

name: epicurus
text: The saying also works with tattoos.

name: leon_sumbitches
text:
Hunde mögen bumsen und schlafen!

interesting thing to say after blowing your brains out!

name: tinhand
text: There is an immense novelty in just how weird Klaus Nomi is. I feel..strangely compelled to listen to more of his music. God knows what made Chris reference him here, but then again this is just typical of Achewood.

name: godfatherofsouls
text: I feel compelled to listen to more as well. But he never made any more. Thanks a lot, AIDS.

name: zefiel
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: soilentshuggah
text: The last panel is probably one of my favorites in Achewood history, gotta love the Lowenbrau bit.

name: straw
text: Except, of course, that it is Cat Klaus Nomi

name: tagrineth
text: Scarily enough, this implies that somehow, the weirdness of Klaus Nomi occurred in not just one but two living beings in Achewood's world. O. o

name: sarmatron
text: It's actually a teddy bear, I think.

name: afronaut
text: Damn. There is a show about blood tonight

name: jackparsons
text: The Venture Brothers episodes "Showdown at Cremation Creek (Parts 1 & 2) would have worked even better with Klaus as a cat. All cats are countertenors. Not sure what David Bowie would be. Iggy is definitely a dog. Or one of those raccoon-cousin coatimundi/jaguarundi/kinkajou things. Achewood "Velvet Goldmine". That's what we need.

name: epicurus
text: I didn't understand a word of this beyond "Venture Brothers" but that's enough for you to get a chubby.

name: tekende
text: I think it would make some sense for David Bowie to be a lizard of some sort given that The Church's song "Reptile" was about Bowie.

name: foea
text:
I'm jealous you beat me to the VB ref, but you delved into furry territory.
That stuff is just not ok.

name: salvar
text: David Bowie is a diamond dog. And a spider from Mars. And an eagle . It is only right that he be a shapeshifter.

name: saru
text: Which makes a lot of since, him being the goblin king and all.

name: ctaronno
text: Respect for Onstad just went up exponentially because of the fact that he even knows of Klaus Nomi.

name: deusoma
text: My respect for Klaus Nomi just went up because of the fact that Onstad deigns to reference him in Achewood.

name: yourmalarky
text: Lowenbrau is incredible. We went there for our last night in munich and they found a bomb from WW2 in the construction lot next door and we had to evacuate to 100m. Really delicious beer though

name: dj_insomniac
text: Chubby for H-Dogg.

name: sheer
text: Next time I read through the archives, I'm going to take a shot everytime someone shoots themself in the head.

name: fancyrat
text: Even though this is in German, I get the feeling Tarkovsky's spirit was guiding Onstad's hand here.

name: fattypneumonia
text: My wife thought the statue looked like John Cleese in this sketch.

name: genequagmire
text: That is so not what that says.  /teutophone

name: kaithekender
text:
Gesellschaft is a sociological concept.

"Gemeinschaft (often translated as community) is an association in which individuals are oriented to the large association as much if not more than to their own self interest."

"In contrast, Gesellschaft (often translated as society or civil society or 'association') describes associations in which, for the individual, the larger association never takes on more importance than the individual's self interest, and lack the same level of shared mores."

From the wikipedia article. Basically modern city-dwellers live in a gesellschaft society, whereas rural denizens and nearly everybody in the past lived in a gemeinschaft society.
